title: Labeling Players Toxic
body:
So i recently got reported in my latest ranked game. My last account was banned by riot since end of 2016. 
In order to change i played on my new account by complimenting team members and being sportsmanlike all around.
I reached lvl 4 honor last season and now i'm getting key fragments frequently for being sportsmanlike. 
When i started playing ranked, i barely use all chat and most of the time communicate by pings. 
In my latest game, when i was playing veigar i missed out on opportunities that could have ended with triple kills for me because i was caught out. Botlane ganks me and Diana mid is behind me, i'm playing veigar and i have to stun 3. Two on my right and 1 on my left. My jungler Kha is next to my turret and im next to the drag bushes. Karma comes in behind and i decide to 2v1 botlane so i e and w. I'm close to getting kills when i see that Karma has left me and didn't even slow them or affect them in anyway. She goes next to Kha and uses her abilities. End result 1 death and no kills for my team. Kha really helped me out, despite him getting the kills and me stunning. 

To get to the point frustrated that twice Karma could have at least slowed them or done anything i call her bad in chat and she apologises. I make a joke about how i would never accept the apology of a "bad" player and move on.  Me and Kha as well as top laner Nasus control the right side of the map and dominate catching out mid, top and jglers one by one. They surrendre by 19 minutes and MF labels me as toxic and reports me.
After game i try getting an explanation so i message the MF to which she replies "i reported so riot can filter negative language out of the game"

So my question to you is, are we supposed to have the club penguin chat filter on so not a single bit of reality and negativity can be in the game? Are we not allowed to judge someone from their performance without insulting and offensive behavior. Or does calling someone bad really hurt their reputation?  How else are we supposed to demonstrate the frustration we feel and the importance to discuss it so our team members can so that we get affected by the choices they make in game. 

Because in reality, labeling someone as "a toxic person" based on one or two words we said can really damage the person too. In fact i believe judging peoples personal attributes and behavior is more damaging than talking STRICTLY about League of Legends and Performance related issues. I don't like others in game  calling others names.

Sorry for the amount of errors this forum has. I was in a rush.

Yes it is lol. If i went into the game and said "we gonna win this neegahs" and then someone decides to report, that's a false report. its a discriminating word with no context. It's not aimed at anyone and it's obviously not meant to be abusive and it's in a positive manner. Does riots report bot pick up on that? No. All it will highlight is the word %%%%%s and be like "BAN HAMMER OF JUSTICE".

A lot of people in the community don't appreciate slurs, and the fact it is now an instant escalated punishment just backs this up. There must be a lot of people reporting for this kind of thing, even if you try to be smart and avoid the system with alternative spelling. Factoring in community attitude around such words, I wouldn't really consider it a false report. 

TBH, there is not really any context where such language is really needed, you can always use a different word and not risk punishment? It's not hard.

bullsh*t its not i can find numerous cases where a single report resulted in a punishment which resulted in a permaban due to the account having being suspended previously- you can twist it how u want but 1report+previous punishments can result in a single report destroying an account. i appealed one that had zero swear words etc. Staff couldn't even tell me what the problem was, all they care about is you have previous record and the case is closed.

1 report is all that it takes to trigger a punishment, yes. 
1 false report will do nothing. 

If you wish, you can always post your chat log here and the community can have a go telling you what might have been the thing to get you punished. 

There are plenty of cases where no obvious things jumped out, like no swearing or slurs, however it was found that the people in question were just constantly dwelling on and pointing out the mistakes of their teammates in a whiny manner, something that usually isn't appreciated. In cases like that, you get escalated through the 3 punishment tiers before the perma, giving the person plenty of warning to stop being a lowkey dick. 

Players like that get a lot of reports over a lot of games, indicating that the community doesn't want them.

It's a rigged game. Everyone I know disappreciate useless and Lower skilled players that are causing better players gameplay to be affected due to their unwillingness to communicate and help out or make an effort to. They find pings annoying and feel like they are too good to be told what to do. I was in a Game with a disillususional jungler with score 2.17 blaming team for not helping every death. I replied by calling him terrible and that he should play  smarter and get chat ban.

He attacks me for not helping and types in all chat "gg" or "this team" "no help" which I don't like. Briefing in all chat shows vulnerability an drew less chemistry

The term "toxic" gets thrown around a lot, even when not valid.

I was playing an ARAM the other day, and I was {{champion:9}} . I asked my team (in particular {{champion:51}} ), to please not attack the minion I'm healing off. She kept doing it.
So I go and take a heal that she was running for.
I get a "omfg, I needed that more than you, why did you take it?"
I reply with "you keep attacking my drain targets for cs, so I'll take the heals instead" or something along those lines.
I then get berated by the Cait and her friend Annie, "report Fiddles, so toxic, blah blah blah".
Annie and Cait both said "we are now going to intentionally deny you any heals off minions".
I'm like "omfg, I took ONE heal, so toxic".
I proceeded to deal top damage, have highest kill participation, most CC, etc

This is the state of OCE.
Who was the toxic player(s) in this situation?

That's the thing I hate about OCE the most - the spitefulness. Instead of just working with you as a team, they would rather turn the game into a 3 v 7. And then they label you toxic. Brainless children.

On the one hand, calling someone bad, having them take the high road and apologise and then telling them "i would never accept the apology of a bad player", doesn't exactly sound like a joke, and I highly doubt it came across as one. In fact I think most people would definitely label that as toxic, if mundanely so. You're straight up abusing another player.

On the other hand, you were only reported, not punished. If that was all you said, it's not going to get you punished, though it may contribute as negative history  in the future.

>I don't like others in game calling others names.

And yet, you called someone bad, simply because they probably panicked and didn't play how you wanted them to. Is that fair to them?

You were dead, you had time to type. You could have said "Karma if you'd stayed we could have killed them" or "I'm stronger than you think stick with me". Instead you just said "you're bad". It's not productive, and instead of them thinking "I could have done this better", they're far more likely to think "well this guys toxic" and just ignore you and be frustrated themselves.

Everyone gets frustrated sometimes, but 'joking' about how bad your team is isn't a healthy way to alleviate that frustration. It makes you play worse, it makes them play worse and it probably doesn't actually make you any less frustrated, so what then is the point?
